Record.BroaderTerm: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
Record.Synonym: Carbamoyl Phosphate Synthetase I Deficiency Disease
Hyperammonemia Due to Carbamoyl Phosphate Synthetase 1 Deficiency
Carbamoyl-Phosphate Synthase I Deficiency Disease (Ornithine Carbamoyl Phosphate Deficiency)
Carbamyl Phosphate Synthetase I Deficiency Disease
Record.Description: A urea cycle disorder manifesting in infancy as lethargy, emesis, seizures, alterations of muscle tone, abnormal eye movements, and an elevation of serum ammonia. The disorder is caused by a reduction in the activity of hepatic mitochondrial CARBAMOYL-PHOSPHATE SYNTHASE (AMMONIA). (Menkes, Textbook of Child Neurology, 5th ed, pp50-1)
